item.title: Whats the problem here?
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

You could also minimize Simba halfway down the screen so that the mouse clicks the url bar. I changed the script to this, its better than using ClickMouse:

[code=pascal]program new;
{$I SRL/SRL.scar}

procedure Advert;
begin
MMouse(200, 48, 0, 0);
Wait(500);
Mouse(200, 48, 0, 0, True);
Wait(500);
SendKeys(‘www.kijiji.ca’);
SendKeys(Chr(13));
Wait(2000);
Mouse(736, 108, 0, 0, True);
Wait(1000);
end;

begin
SetupSRL;
Advert;
end.[/code]

You need SRL enabled to use this btw

Read full topic

item.title: Whats the problem here?
item.dc:creator: @arraness14 arraness14
item.description:
@arraness14 wrote:

Thanks for your help Echo

The script compiled but the sendkeys command is directed towards SIMBA instead of the client I directed it to.

Read full topic

item.title: Whats the problem here?
item.dc:creator: @Echo3 Echo_
item.description:
@Echo3 wrote:

[quote=“arraness14, post:1, topic:418669”]begin procedure advert; begin clickmouse(200, 48,true); wait(1000); sendkeys('www.kijiji.ca'); sendkeys(chr(13)); wait(2000); clickmouse(736, 108,true); wait(1000); end.

Its meant to work with firefox but i need to know what that error message means.[/quote]

You can’t declare a procedure inside of the main loop. Try this instead:

[code=pascal]procedure Advert;
begin
ClickMouse(200, 48, 1);
Wait(1000);
SendKeys(‘www.kijiji.ca’);
SendKeys(Chr(13));
Wait(2000);
ClickMouse(736, 108, 1);
Wait(1000);
end;

begin
Advert;
end.[/code]

Read full topic
